info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 5:27PM CDT until June 30 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR EASTERN THOMAS...SOUTHEASTERN RAWLINS...WESTERN SHERIDAN AND SOUTHWESTERN DECATUR COUNTIES... At 526 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Gem, or 6 miles northeast of Colby, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Mesonet. A 60 mph wind gust was reported at the Colby Airport at 525pm CT. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Gem around 530 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Rexford, Menlo, Selden and Hoxie. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 52 and 74. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
